sub_title: Head of Data & Augmentation Department. Social Inequality. Linked Open Data. Cultural Heritage. Coordinator women's soccer VVOG. Youth soccer coach VVOG. Fly Fishing Instructor.
summary:
I am a Chief Innovation Officer (CInO) and Researcher at the International Institute of Social History (IISH). 
As CInO, I:
- Focus on expanding the use of cultural heritage sources and combining them research data 
- Enhance the value of existing datasets (e.g. by linking them to data from other data centers)
- Am Project lead of the Clariah Structured Datahub which curates micro-, meso- and macro- social-economic historical data and links it through RDF
- Perform research on long term changes in social stratifications structures, such as in gender segregation and occupational stratification.

# On my research:
-Topics: social inequality of occupations, long term trends in occupational segregation and stratification (1800-2000), global labour relations (1500-2000), household structures

- Approach:
- Contextual: quantifying and analyzing the influence of macro level processes (e.g.: industrialization, digitalization) on micro level outcomes (e.g.: status attainment, female labour force participation)
- Interdisciplinary: including digital humanities, sociology, economics and demography

Skills (summary) and Expertise:
- (Linked) Data curation and analysis: R, Stata, MLwiN, SPSS, QGIS, SPARQL
- Occupational coding and classification systems
- University teaching
- Cooperation and social networking skills
- Project Management

education.field_of_study: long term, quantitative, sociology of inequality
Math, English, German, Dutch, Economics, Commercial Economics

awards.title: Winner of the Hack-A-LOD Audience (2017) and Overall (2018) Award
KDP Grant (10k Euro)
awards.description: The aim of the nlgis2 project is to reestablish the services provided by the nlgis project. The original nlgis project allowed researchers to upload data on characteristics of Dutch municipalities in the 19th and 20th century and plot that data on a map using Onno Boonstra's shapefiles ([urn:nbn:nl:ui:13-wsh-wv7]). In addition, nlgis2 aims to provide an R-package to easily plot such data in the R-environment using existing packages. Finally, there are various datasets on municipality characteristics that we aim to provide through a web service. https://github.com/rlzijdeman/nlgis2/

certifications.name: Basic university teaching qualification
certifications.authority: Dean of the Faculty of Social Sciences

projects.title: Clariah Structured Data Hub
projects.description: Currently data sources from different disciplines within the (digital) humanities live in isolation and researchers are virtually unable to draw on different types of sources at the same time. The Common Lab Research Infrastructure for the Arts and Humanities (CLARIAH) aims to link different types of sources, so information on a specific topic can be derived from tabular-like datasets, texts (newspapers, books), as well as movies (e.g. polygon news). The Clariah Structured Data Hub (CSDH) takes care of linking historical tabular-like datasets, as well as providing tools for historians link their own data to that of others.

profile_positions.title: Honorary Research Fellow

profile_positions.description:
- Organize, asses and expand on the research data provided by the IISH
- Enhance the value of existing datasets (e.g. by linking them to data from other data centers)
- Project lead of the Clariah Structured Datahub which curates micro-, meso- and macro- social-economic historical data and links it through RDF
- Perform research on long term changes in social stratifications structures, such as in gender segregation and occupational stratification.
profile_positions.title: Chief Data Officer

profile_positions.description: Post-doctoral researcher at CLIO-INFRA (http://www.clio-infra.eu/), a NWO funded project gathering indicators to study global inequality for the past 400 years. I am engaged in the HUB focussing on regional and temporal differences in life expectancy. Furthermore, I am part of the Global Collaboratory on Labour Relations (https://collab.iisg.nl/web/labourrelations), which aims to make an inventory of all types of labour relations worldwide, varying from slavery, indentured labour and share cropping, to free wage labour and self-employment from 1500 up until today.
profile_positions.title: Post-Doctoral Fellow
Research Programme Director (Life-courses, Family, and Labour')

profile_positions.description: Post-doctoral researcher at the ERC funded project 'United We Stand' (http://www.collective-action.info). In this project, I study changes over time in household structures in relation to social inequalities in the 17th-20th centuries. As part of this project I am identifying the possibilities of genealogical data to study long term trends and regional differences in occupational stratification, such gender segregation.
profile_positions.title: Post-Doctoral Fellow
Chair of the Education Advisory Committee (Department of Sociology)

profile_positions.description:
# Substantive: Describe and explain female labour force participation in UK and France in the 19th and 20th centuries.
# Methodological: Designed a method and database "HISCI" to attach various databases based on their geographical information that changes over time.
# Methodological: Developed a measure to compare historical occupations for social stratification research in the 19th and 20th centuries
